channel.title: Winter 2013 on UCOSP
channel.description: Recent content in Winter 2013 on UCOSP

item.title: UCOSP Students Landing Patches
item.description: As the UCOSP term starts to wind down Mike DeLong (UGuelph) and Alex Kwan (SFU) have managed to land their contribution for the term. Details about their experience building the Webworks barcode scanning extension are online.

item.title: Formulize Checks In
item.description: Jeffrey Ling from the University of Toronto reports on his experience working with the Formulize project for UCOSP this term.

item.title: Blackberry midterm update
item.description: Amritpal and Willie reflect on their experiences with the Blackberry team so far this term.

item.title: UMPLE’s first post of Winter 2013
item.description: Here is the first blog post from Umple, written by Geoffrey Guest. Flying has never been a joy of mine, however, we made it here in one piece so I guess I can’t really complain. I met up with another UCOSPer, purely by coincedence, on the way down. It turns out we both fit the bill of “computer science student” in our own imaginations. The weekend was already shaping up to be an excellent social and academic experience.

item.title: Winter 2013 Kicks Off
item.description: This term’s code sprint was held at Facebook Headquarters in California. Holding the sprint outside of Canada was a first for UCOSP, but it enabled us to join up with 110 students from several US and International schools that were also holding a similar weekend hackfest on the Facebook campus. This term 43 students from 19 Canadian universities are working on 7 different projects. Photos to follow.
